Next Steps#

You’ve completed the Quick Start guide! Where you go next depends on your goals and experience level.

Choose Your Path#

I want to… solve a specific problem quickly#

Go directly to the examples:

  • Linear Regression Power - Simple models + feature engineering = powerful results

  • Classification with FeatureSynthesizer - Classification with automated feature engineering

  • Interpreting Discovered Features - Understanding what the algorithm discovered

  • ../examples/example_summary - Overview of all examples

Time: 10-30 minutes per example

I want to… understand how it works#

Start with the conceptual guides:

  • ../concepts/genetic_feature_synthesis - How genetic algorithms discover features

  • ../concepts/symbolic_regression - What is symbolic regression?

  • ../concepts/mrmr - Maximum Relevance Minimum Redundancy

  • ../concepts/parsimony - Why simplicity matters

Time: 30-60 minutes

I want to… master the API#

Study the API reference:

  • High-Level API - FeatureSynthesizer and FeatureSelector

  • Rust Functions - Low-level tree operations

  • Rust Classes - Population and MRMR classes

Time: 1-2 hours

I want to… integrate into production#

Learn production patterns:

  • Scikit-learn Integration - Pipeline integration, GridSearchCV

  • ../user_guide/advanced_topics - Performance optimization, reproducibility

  • ../development/architecture - Rust/Python hybrid architecture

Time: 1-2 hours

Recommended Learning Path#

Beginner (New to Featuristic)

  1. Installation - Set up your environment

  2. Quick Start Guide - Get started in 5 minutes ✓ (you are here)

  3. Linear Regression Power - See the full potential

  4. Feature Synthesis Tutorial - Learn synthesis parameters

  5. Feature Selection Tutorial - Evolutionary feature selection

Time: 2-3 hours

Intermediate (Comfortable with ML)

  1. Complete Beginner path (above)

  2. Classification with FeatureSynthesizer - Classification workflows

  3. Interpreting Discovered Features - Understanding discovered features

  4. Fitness Functions Guide - Choosing the right metric

  5. Custom Symbolic Functions - Adding custom functions

Time: 3-4 hours

Advanced (Ready for production)

  1. Complete Intermediate path (above)

  2. Scikit-learn Integration - Production pipelines

  3. ../concepts/genetic_feature_synthesis - Algorithm deep dive

  4. ../concepts/mrmr - Feature selection theory

  5. ../user_guide/advanced_topics - Optimization and best practices

Time: 4-5 hours

Developer (Contributing to Featuristic)

  1. Complete Advanced path (above)

  2. ../development/contributing - Contribution guide

  3. ../development/architecture - Code architecture

  4. ../development/adding_functions - Adding Rust functions

  5. ../development/testing - Testing guidelines

Time: 5-6 hours

Performance Optimization

  • Start with Feature Synthesis Tutorial

  • Then ../user_guide/advanced_topics

By Example#

Run example scripts to see Featuristic in action:

Linear Regression Power (Most Popular)

cd examples
python 01_linear_regression_power.py

Demonstrates: +2400% R² improvement with linear models

Feature Selection

python 02_feature_selection_demo.py

Demonstrates: Evolutionary selection from 100 → 10 features

Friedman Benchmark

python 03_friedman_benchmark.py

Demonstrates: Classic symbolic regression test

All Examples:

See ../examples/example_summary for complete list.

Common Workflows#

Workflow 1: Quick Experiment

from featuristic import FeatureSynthesizer
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor

# Load data (your dataset here)
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.2)

# Create features
synth = FeatureSynthesizer(n_features=10, generations=30, random_state=42)
X_train_aug = synth.fit_transform(X_train, y_train)

# Train model
model = RandomForestRegressor()
model.fit(X_train_aug, y_train)

# Inspect features
for prog in synth.get_programs():
    print(prog['expression'])

Workflow 2: Thorough Search

# More evolution time
synth = FeatureSynthesizer(
    n_features=20,
    population_size=100,
    generations=100,
    parsimony_coefficient=0.005,
    random_state=42
)

Workflow 3: Production Pipeline

from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

pipeline = Pipeline([
    ('scaler', StandardScaler()),
    ('synthesis', FeatureSynthesizer(n_features=10, random_state=42)),
    ('model', LogisticRegression())
])

pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)

See Scikit-learn Integration for details.

Parameters Quick Reference#

Essential Parameters:

  • n_features (default: 10) - Number of features to create

  • generations (default: 25) - Evolution time (higher = better but slower)

  • population_size (default: 50) - Population diversity

  • fitness (default: “auto”) - Metric to optimize

  • parsimony_coefficient (default: 0.001) - Complexity penalty

Selection Methods:

  • selection_method="mrmr" (default) - Maximum Relevance Minimum Redundancy

  • selection_method="best" - Select best by fitness score

Genetic Operators:

  • tournament_size (default: 5) - Selection pressure

  • crossover_prob (default: 0.75) - Crossover probability

  • mutation_prob (default: 0.25) - Mutation probability

Reproducibility:

  • random_state - Seed for reproducibility (always use this!)

  • early_stopping (default: True) - Stop if no improvement

Getting Help#

Documentation:

  • Use the search bar (top-right) to find topics

  • Check API Reference for API details

  • See Examples for working code

Examples:

  • All examples are in examples/ directory

  • Run them directly: python examples/01_linear_regression_power.py

  • See Code Examples for descriptions

Community:

  • GitHub Issues - Bug reports and feature requests

What to Learn Next#

Based on your interests:

I want better performance:

  • Feature Synthesis Tutorial - Tune synthesis parameters

  • ../user_guide/advanced_topics - Optimization techniques

  • ../concepts/genetic_feature_synthesis - Understand the algorithm

I want interpretable models:

  • Linear Regression Power - Linear models + features

  • Interpreting Discovered Features - Understanding discovered features

  • ../concepts/symbolic_regression - Theory of interpretability

I want to reduce features:

  • Feature Selection Tutorial - Evolutionary feature selection

  • ../concepts/mrmr - Maximum Relevance Minimum Redundancy

  • ../examples/example_summary - Feature selection examples

I want to use in production:

  • Scikit-learn Integration - Pipeline integration

  • ../user_guide/advanced_topics - Production patterns

  • ../development/architecture - System architecture

I want to extend Featuristic:

  • Custom Symbolic Functions - Adding custom functions

  • ../development/adding_functions - Rust implementation

  • ../development/adding_fitness - Custom fitness metrics
